com.google.closure.plugin.common

Class Ingredients

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.closure.plugin.common.Ingredients

  • public final class Ingredients
extends Object
    Pools ingredients based on key.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Ingredients.Bundle<I extends Ingredient>
      A bundle of ingredients.
      class  Ingredients.DirScanFileSetIngredient
      A set of files whose hash is the file paths, not their content, and which is hashable when explicitly resolved.
      static class  Ingredients.FileIngredient
      An ingredient backed by a file which is hashable when the file exists.
      class  Ingredients.FileSetIngredient
      A group of files that need not be known at construct time.
      static class  Ingredients.HashedInMemory<T extends Serializable>
      Specifies how the compiler should interpret a group of source files and where to look for those source files.
      static class  Ingredients.PathValue
      An ingredient that represents a path, and hashes to a hash of that path, not the content of the file referred to by that path.
      static class  Ingredients.SerializedObjectIngredient<T extends Serializable>
      An ingredient back by a file dedicated to hold a serialized object of a specific type.
      class  Ingredients.SettableFileSetIngredient
      A file-set that can be explicitly set.
      static class  Ingredients.StringValue
      An ingredient that represents a fixed string.
      static class  Ingredients.UriValue
      An ingredient that represents a URI, and hashes to a hash of that URI's text, not the content referred to by that URI.

                                                                                           Class<T> contentType)
                                                                                    throws IOException
        An ingredient back by a file dedicated to hold a serialized object of a specific type. Reading and writing must be done explicitly and the hash is of the version in memory.
